subject: Psychology
title: Early Women in Psychology
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Early Women in Psychology.

hook.text: Mary Whiton Calkins was denied a PhD by Harvard despite completing all requirements. Her crime: being a woman.

buildup.text: Early psychology excluded women from degrees and positions, yet women made foundational contributions.

discovery.text: Calkins invented the paired-associate technique and became the first female APA president in 1905.

twist.text: Margaret Floy Washburn earned the first PhD in psychology awarded to a woman. Her animal cognition work was pioneering.

climax.text: Psychology's history was shaped by women who had to fight for a seat at the table they helped build.

punchline.text: They were denied credit but built the foundations anyway.

quiz.question: Who was the first female president of the American Psychological Association?
